title: Emma Thompson 'tries to save fired waiter after he asked for a selfie'
text:
Emma Thompson hopes to get waiter job back after he was fired for trying to take a selfie with her (Picture: Mike Marsland/Mike Marsland/WireImage)

Emma Thompson has rushed to the defence of a waiter who got fired for trying to take a selfie with her, according to reports.

Last Saturday, the 60-year-old actress was dining at exclusive Mayfair restaurant Brown’s with a gaggle of celebrity friends.

A waiter spotted the celebs and allegedly broke the restaurant’s protocol to ask Emma if he could grab a quick selfie with her.

It’s been reported she politely declined and reasoned she didn’t want to impose on her guests.

Emma Thompson is reportedly not a fan of selfies (Picture: Gisela Schober/Getty Images)

The next day, the restaurant suspended the waiter ‘until further notice’, according to The Times.

The owner of Brown’s, Rocco Forte Hotels, explained it had ‘a strict policy of respecting guests’ privacy which applies to all staff members.’

And when the publication approached Emma for comment, she was reportedly ‘horrified’ to learn of the waiter’s fate and immediately called the restaurant to urge them to reverse the decision.

Brown’s declined to comment further on the matter, citing concerns for ‘privacy and wellbeing of both team members and guests’.

Emma Thompson recently came under fire for flying 5,400 miles to attend a climate change protest, with many calling it ‘hypocritical’.

A flight from Los Angeles International Airport to London Heathrow generates around 1.67 tonnes of CO2.

Emma said that while it may have been hypocritical of her to fly to the protest, that is ‘not the story’.

Emma Thompson was approached by Metro.co.uk for comment.
